description: Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish commonly served as a street food and in restaurants in Thailand. It typically includes rice noodles, tofu, shrimp, bean sprouts, peanuts, egg, and a tangy sauce made of tamarind, fish sauce, garlic, and chili.

Sushi is a Japanese dish consisting of vinegared rice combined with various ingredients such as seafood (like salmon, tuna, or shrimp), vegetables, and sometimes tropical fruits. It's often served with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

Spaghetti Carbonara is a classic Italian pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, cheese (typically Pecorino Romano or Parmesan), pancetta or guanciale, and black pepper. The heat from the pasta and freshly cooked pancetta creates a creamy sauce without the need for cream.

Tacos are traditional Mexican dishes composed of a corn or wheat tortilla folded or rolled around a filling. Common fillings include beef, chicken, pork, fish, or vegetables, often accompanied by toppings like salsa, guacamole, onions, and cilantro.

Chicken Tikka Masala is a popular Indian dish consisting of marinated and grilled chunks of chicken in a creamy, tomato-based sauce. It's flavored with various spices such as cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, and often served with rice or naan bread.

Caesar Salad is a classic salad made with romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan cheese, and a dressing composed of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, and anchovies. It's often topped with grilled chicken or shrimp.

Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup dish consisting of Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or fish-based broth, often flavored with soy sauce or miso, and toppings like sliced pork, seaweed, green onions, and boiled eggs.

A hamburger is a sandwich consisting of a cooked ground meat patty, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun. Common toppings include lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, cheese, and condiments such as ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise.

Biryani is a fragrant rice dish cooked with aromatic spices, basmati rice, and meat, typically chicken or mutton. It's layered and cooked in a sealed pot, allowing the flavors to blend together beautifully.

Pizza is an Italian dish consisting of a yeasted flatbread typically topped with tomato sauce, cheese (usually mozzarella), and various toppings such as meats, vegetables, and herbs. It's baked in an oven until the crust is crispy and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Rasgulla is a popular Indian dessert made from chhena (an Indian cottage cheese) dough, cooked in sugar syrup until it becomes soft and spongy. It's typically served chilled and garnished with saffron or cardamom.

Pho is a Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat, primarily beef or chicken. The broth is typically seasoned with aromatics like ginger, onion, and star anise, and served with toppings like bean sprouts, lime, basil, and chili.

Lamb Kebab is a Middle Eastern dish made from skewered and grilled pieces of lamb meat, often marinated with spices, herbs, and yogurt. It's typically served with rice, bread, and various accompaniments like salad, pickles, and sauces.

Pasta Primavera is an Italian pasta dish that translates to 'spring pasta'. It typically consists of pasta (such as spaghetti or fettuccine) tossed with fresh vegetables like bell peppers, tomatoes, broccoli, carrots, and peas, in a light sauce.

Chicken Shawarma is a Middle Eastern street food made from thinly sliced marinated chicken, stacked on a vertical rotisserie and roasted. It's typically served wrapped in pita bread with garlic sauce, tahini, pickles, and vegetables.

Eggplant Parmesan, or Melanzane alla Parmigiana, is an Italian dish made from thinly sliced eggplant, breaded and fried, then layered with marinara sauce and cheese (usually mozzarella and Parmesan), and baked until bubbly and golden.

Gyoza are Japanese dumplings filled with ground meat (usually pork), vegetables, and seasonings, wrapped in thin dough and pan-fried until crispy on the bottom. They're typically served with a dipping sauce made from soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil.

Chicken Satay is a popular Southeast Asian dish consisting of skewered and grilled pieces of marinated chicken, served with a peanut sauce for dipping. It's often accompanied by rice cakes, cucumber slices, and a side salad.

Miso Soup is a traditional Japanese soup made from dashi (fish stock), miso paste, and ingredients like tofu, seaweed, and green onions. It's often served as a starter in Japanese meals and is known for its savory and umami flavors.

Beef Wellington is a classic British dish consisting of beef tenderloin coated with pâté and duxelles (a mixture of finely chopped mushrooms, shallots, and herbs), then wrapped in puff pastry and baked until golden and crispy.

Tiramisu is a popular Italian dessert made from layers of espresso-soaked ladyfingers, mascarpone cheese, and cocoa powder. It's chilled before serving, allowing the flavors to meld together and create a rich and creamy treat.

Falafel is a Middle Eastern dish made from ground chickpeas or fava beans, mixed with herbs, spices, and onion, formed into balls or patties, and deep-fried until crispy. It's often served in pita bread with tahini sauce and salad.

Shrimp Scampi is an Italian-American dish consisting of large shrimp sautéed in garlic-infused butter, white wine, and lemon juice, then served over pasta or crusty bread. It's typically garnished with parsley and grated Parmesan cheese.

Kung Pao Chicken is a classic Chinese stir-fry dish made with diced chicken, peanuts, vegetables (like bell peppers and zucchini), and chili peppers, all cooked in a spicy and savory sauce made from soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and vinegar.

Ratatouille is a French Provencal stewed vegetable dish made with tomatoes, zucchini, eggplant, bell peppers, onions, and garlic, cooked in olive oil and seasoned with herbs like thyme, basil, and oregano. It's often served as a side dish or over pasta.

Ceviche is a Latin American dish made from raw fish marinated in citrus juice (like lime or lemon), mixed with onions, chili peppers, and cilantro, and seasoned with salt and pepper. The acid in the citrus juice 'cooks' the fish, giving it a firm texture.

Goulash is a Hungarian stew made with beef or pork, onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, and paprika, cooked until the meat is tender and the flavors are well-developed. It's often served with noodles, potatoes, or bread.

Samosa is a popular Indian snack made from a crispy pastry shell filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat or lentils. It's typically deep-fried until golden brown and served with chutney for dipping.

Lasagna is an Italian pasta dish made with layers of lasagna noodles, marinara sauce, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and sometimes meat (like ground beef or sausage). It's baked until bubbly and golden, creating a rich and comforting meal.

Tandoori Chicken is an Indian dish made from marinated chicken (often with yogurt and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric) cooked in a tandoor (clay oven) until charred and smoky. It's typically served with naan bread and yogurt sauce.
